Rainsberger/Slava,
	I did test this idea and as Rainsberger had pointed out=
, it does not  allow ignoring failures in the same test method.
On the cont=
rary, if set haltonfailure is set on, it would abort the entire build proce=
ss.

Thanks for your inputs though.

Raj

-----Original Message-----
From: =
junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]On Behalf Of
J. B. Rain=
sberger
Sent: Tuesday, July 25, 2006 1:28 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subj=
ect: Re: [junit] Re: Junit reporting


Slava Imeshev wrote:

>  > Hi All,
>=
  > I am using JUnit for regression testing. One of my test case
> methods =
executes same testconditions with a list of input data. When one
> of my te=
st case condition fails, JUnit reports failure and aborts from
> further ex=
ecuting the other test data.
>  >
>  > While it reports the failure, I woul=
d love it to execute the other
> tests also in the test method and report t=
heir results. Is there a way
> to make JUnit it to report alone and ignore =
the failures to continue
> testing.
> 
> You could use junit ant task prope=
rties haltonfailure=3D"off" and
> haltonerror=3D"off". Example:
> 
> <junit=
 fork=3D"yes" printsummary=3D"on" haltonfailure=3D"off"
> haltonerror=3D"of=
f" errorproperty=3D"test.errors"
> failureproperty=3D"test.errors">
> ...
>=
 </junit>

I am not an Ant expert, but I don't believe that will work. It a=
llows a 
test suite to continue executing if a test fails, but each test wi=
ll 
still stop executing after the first assertion failure.
-- 
J. B. (Joe)=
 Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info

p
